misuse: Not securely generating the AES key
vulnerable_code:
KeyGenerator keyGen = KeyGenerator.getInstance("AES");
SecretKey key = keyGen.generateKey();
description: The code is using the KeyGenerator class to generate a secret key for AES encryption. KeyGenerator.getInstance() returns a KeyGenerator object. The init(int keysize) method can then be used to specify the size, in bits, of the secret key to be generated.
recommendation: Using the KeyGenerator class for AES key generation without specifying the key size is generally considered insecure. It is recommended to use either a fixed key size or to generate a random key size. The recommended key size is 256 bits.
